TopicTitle: Episode 28: Star Dreck | It's Hardly Rocket Science

Articles.Content: Yes! I knew this comic wasn't dead!
That's two star trek comics in a row! are you becoming obsessed with Star Trek over KSP like I did in inverse?

That's two star trek comics in a row! are you becoming obsessed with Star Trek over KSP like I did in inverse?

He must be purged from this star trek and returned to the one holy kerbal way.
Hmm. Wouldn't there be two engines instead of one showing that overheats, if both go poof?

Hmm. Wouldn't there be two engines instead of one showing that overheats, if both go poof?

There's only one warp engine, just two nacelles.

Yeah, one warp core (which is where the matter-antimatter reaction happens) then two warp nacelles which do the spacetime bending.

</trekkie>

Anyhow yes - if the warp core goes poof, it's probably safe to say that both nacelles do as well Along with most everything else in the vicinity.

Yeah, one warp core (which is where the matter-antimatter reaction happens) then two warp nacelles which do the spacetime bending.

Ah, a good excuse why they aren't aligned with the COM. One less sci-fi design that's ruined by playing KSP.

Ah, KSP physics... Where would Star Trek be without you?

Wait... there's a lot of places it would be without KSP physics... Uh... Carry on then!

Ah, a good excuse why they aren't aligned with the COM. One less sci-fi design that's ruined by playing KSP.

Actually, the reason the COM/COT is not off is because the warp nacelles don't generate thrust, they warp space. The impulse engines which do in fact create thrust, are on the COM.
